The kinase mTOR is a complex of two mTOR components, mTORC1 and 417 mTORC2, which have different protein components (Bhaskar and Hay, 2007) . 418 mTORC1 is a major negative regulator of autophagy, and the PI3K/Akt pathway is a major upstream major modulator of mTORC1 (Schmelzle and Hall, 2000) . To 420 investigate the mechanism by which JZ-1 induces autophagy, we assessed the changes 421 in the classic PI3K/Akt/mTOR pathway in the VK2/E6E7 cells.
